page.title: 05Chatteris - Horseway Travel
page.content:
To get to school the children had to walk across muddy fields to Horseway Bridge, where a horse and cart collected them and took them up New Road into Chatteris.
Barges travelled along the Forty Foot,Vermuden's Drain, carrying fruit,crops and peat to the docks in Chatteris. A floating Church went from Holme Fen along the drain to Manea and the lady told us that three of her relations were christened on it at Holme.
Where New Road joins Langwood Hill Drove was a pub called "The Anchor."Going towards Chatteris near the old cottages was "The Farmer's Boy" and opposite Delve Farm was "The Bird in Hand". People could buy milk,butter and cheese from the farm.
